item.title: Optimal Allocation Model for Sinopec Global Natural Gas Resources
item.description:
• Engineered an efficient resource allocation system for Sinopec’s global natural gas resources by developing a multi-objective procurement and production optimization model, utilizing in-depth data analysis of resource characteristics, pipe network specifics, and demand patterns.
  • Enhanced an increase in profit by crafting a transportation optimization model, which strategically determined pipeline paths and volume, ensuring adherence to strict capacity and demand parameters.

item.title: Model and Algorithm of Enhanced Oil Production in Daqing Oilfield
item.description:
• Optimized a streamlined production planning process by analyzing practical requirements, which entailed defining decision variables, objectives, and constraints while also identifying potential uncertainties in the system.
  • Engineered a production execution plan by constructing a deterministic multi-objective model, utilizing the NSGA-II based algorithm to optimize production outcomes.
  • Enhanced the model’s predictive accuracy by transitioning to a stochastic framework, introducing productivity as a random component, and integrating the deterministic algorithm with Monte Carlo simulations to represent chance constraints.
  • Achieved a drastic reduction in algorithm running time, decreasing it from 1 week to a mere 3 hours, facilitating a swift annual production planning process and significantly boosting overall oil production efficiency.

item.title: Indicator Prediction Model of Adjustment Well in Shengli Oilfield
item.description:
• Accomplished a rigorous model evaluation for oil production prediction by implementing and comparing various predictive models, including transfer function model, SVR, and LSTM, leading to the selection of the highest-performing model.
  • Enhanced planners’ decision-making capabilities by accurately forecasting oil production based on data from 1964 to 2016 using the optimal model, assisting in determining the viability of continuous production in wells.
